Visit Campus

There are 100+ opportunities to visit this summer. Enjoy a 90 minute walking tour of our beautiful campus and an information session with an admissions counselor.

  • First-year students, take a look at our CALENDAR to schedule your visit.

  • Transfer students, give us a call at 800-252-1212 or email admissions@fredonia.edu so we can personally schedule your visit with a transfer counselor.

    • Open House Events Group Visits and Tours Saturday Visits
    Visit Apply Academics Cost & Aid

    Getting into your first-year

    Attending college for the first time is a big decision for your future. You want to make sure that you choose a college that is the right fit for you. We know navigating the college search and application process can be a bit of a challenge, but we are here to help! Feel free to reach out to your Fredonia admissions counselor if you have any questions.

    Visiting Fredonia

    Visit

    We believe Fredonia needs to be experienced. If you are curious about us, there are many opportuntities to help you discover if Fredonia is the right place for you.

    • Daily Weekday Visit Calendar - Schedule your visit right online.
    • Select Saturday Visits
    • Open House Events

    For questions regarding your visit experience, please contact the Office of Admissions at 716-673-3251/ 800-252-1212, or admissions@fredonia.edu

    The Application Process at Fredonia

    Apply

    Once you've decided Fredonia could be the place for you, you may begin to apply the first week in August.

    • Complete the Application (SUNY Application OR Common Application)
    • Personal Essay (SUNY Application Part II)
    • Official High School Transcripts
    • SAT and/or ACT Scores (from the Testing Center or High School)
      • CEEB Code and SAT Code: 2539
      • ACT Code: 2934
    • At least (1) Letter of Recommendation

    Early Decision

    If you are 100% sure Fredonia is the place for you, you may guarentee your spot by applying Early Decision.

    • Select Early Decision on the application
    • Must complete application by Novemeber 1st
    • Must pay deposit by January 15th
    • Once a student is admitted through Early Decision, they are asked to withdraw all other college applications, as Early Decision is a binding agreement.

    Supplemental Requirements

    Some academic majors require an additional step in the application process.

    Audition:

    • School of Music
    • Department of Theatre and Dance

    Portfolio submission:

    • Visual Arts and New Media Department

    Transfer to Fredonia

    Transfer

    Chapter 1: Visit Fredonia

    Visit

    We believe Fredonia needs to be experienced. If you are curious about us, there are many opportuntities to help you discover if Fredonia is the right place for you.

    • Daily Weekday Visits
    • Select Saturday Visits
    • Open House Events

    To schedule your transfer-specific visit, please call (716) 673-3251 or email admissions@fredonia.edu. A transfer visit includes:

    1. An individualized meeting with one of our transfer admissions counselors
    2. A 90-minute walking tour of campus

      3. Chapter 2: The Application Process at Fredonia

      Apply

      Once you've decided Fredonia could be the place for you, you may begin to apply the first week in August.

      • Complete the Application (SUNY Application OR Common Application)
      • Official Transcripts from ALL colleges you have attended
      • Students with fewer than 30 credit hours are required to submit a high school transcript and official SAT/ACT test scores for the application review.
      • All transfer students are required to submit proof of high school graduation. An official high school transcript, copy of diploma, or GED certificate are appropriate.
      • Please reach out to transfer counselor Elizabeth Curtin-O'Brien with questions regarding the process.

    Get an advanced degree

    Graduate Studies

    Fredonia offers excellent master's degree programs in:

    • Master of Arts
    • Master of Arts in Teaching
    • Master of Music
    • Master of Science in Education
    • Master of Science
    • Certificates of Advanced Studies
      Please visit the Graduate Studies Office for more information on specific programs, how to apply and more!

    Learn in the U.S.

    International

    Welcome!

    Getting the American Experience...

    • Take trips to nearby attractions like New York City, Niagara Falls, Washington DC and more.
    • Learn in a welcoming classroom environment
    • Earn your bachelor's or master's degree from a United States university
    • Attend events to share your culture and learn about others
    • Make American friends that last a lifetime
    To learn more about how to attend Fredonia, visit the Office of International Education

    The Application Process for International students

    Apply

    Once you have decided you'd like to attend Fredonia, you may now apply! Below are step-by-step instructions to help you.

    • Complete the Application (SUNY Application OR Common Application) - please DO NOT sumbit both. Application cost is $50. If you cannot apply on-line, you may download a paper copy, here.
    • Personal Essay (A short essay of at least 250 words on a topic of your choosing)
    • Official High School Transcripts. *Include a certified translation if the original is not in English.
        • First-year applicants should provide secondary school transcripts and proof of graduation.
        Transfer applicants should provide university transcripts and transcript evaluation through World Education Services (WES) or a similar service for any college courses taken outside of the United States. More information on WES can be found by visiting WES.org High school transcripts are also required of applicants who have not completed a full year of study at the university level.
    • SAT and/or ACT Scores **Only for international students completing high school in the United States. (Must be sent from the Testing Center or High School)
      • CEEB Code and SAT Code: 2539
      • ACT Code: 2934
    • Financial Statement Form - Submit the Financial Statement form and original documentation proving you have funds to pay for all educational and living expenses for the first year of study.
    • Passport - A clear photocopy of the identification page of your passport

    Admissions Options

    There are three different ways an international student can attend college at Fredonia. Detailed options based on the student's qualifications are listed below.

    1. Direct Admission - Direct Admission means that the student meets all the requirements for the academic program and can demonstrate English proficiency as noted below.
      • SAT verbal score of 480 or,
      • TOEFL score of 79 or,
      • IELTS score of 6.5 or,
      • Demonstrated English Proficiency at High Intermediate Level*
    2. Conditional Admission - Conditional admission means that the student meets all requirements for the academic program except for the English language requirement. The student can then be admitted to the academic program on the condition that he/she enrolls in the EC English language program at Fredonia until the required English language level has been reached.
    3. Concurrent Admission - Concurrent admission means that the student meets all requirements for the academic program except has a low to intermediate English language proficiency. Concurrent admission students will take a combination of English language courses at EC English and major courses at Fredonia in the same semester. Concurrent admission is rare and requires academic department approval. Student's interested in the Concurrent Admission option should contact: international.education@fredonia.edu for further details.

    Never stop learning

    Lifelong Learning and Special Programs

    Continue to learn everyday...

    • To promote ongoing personal and professional enrichment, as well as professional skills development and enhancement, to all those served by the University.
    • To offer continuing education and training programs that are contemporary, outcomes based, and consistent with the University's strengths and expertise.
    • To augment the University's traditional offerings through specialized credit-bearing programs.

    For more information, visit the Office of Lifelong Learning and Special Programs.

    Get some classes completed over the Summer or J-term Sessions

    Finish your degree

    Readmission

    Leave and want to come back?

    • Students who have withdrawn from the university and wish to return begin the process by applying for Readmission/Reinstatement through the Office of Student Affairs.
    • Applications are reviewed by the appropriate academic dean, department chairperson, and the Vice President for Student Affairs or designee
    • Reinstatement Policy

    Please return this APPLICATION to the Student Affairs Office.

      608 MAYTUM HALL, FREDONIA, NY 14063 PHONE (716)673‐3271 FAX (716)673‐3583

    Are you are transfer?

    Open Houses

    Join us at an Open House Event!

    Open House Events provide an opportunity for prospective students and families to meet with academic departments, mingle with representatives from various student service departments, listen to a financial aid session, have lunch and then depart on a 90-minute walking tour of campus. Program's run 11 a.m. through 3 p.m.

    Registration COMING SOON!

      Saturday, April 9, 2016 (Accepted Student Reception)

    *A confirmation email will be sent upon online registration which will include parking information, a map of campus and an itineray of the day.

    Campus Map

    Group Visits and Tours

    Are you interested in bringing a group to campus?

    Complete our Group Visit Registration Form to begin the process.

    Generally, Monday mornings are reserved for large groups, but we are happy to make accommodations for other days and times. Group requests should be made at least two weeks in advance.

    Accommodations for changes made less than 48 hours before your visit may not be feasible.

    Please notify group visit coordinator, Jessica Gatto at jessica.gatto@fredonia.edu, of any changes as soon as possible.

    Visits typically consist of:
    • An hour-long information session with an admissions counselor
    • A 90-minute walking tour of campus

    *Accommodations can be made to eat on campus if needed; we can provide you with lunch options and prices.

    Campus Map

    Saturday Visits

    Visit us on a Saturday!

    Our Saturday Visits offer a welcome, information session with an admissions counselor, and a 90-minute walking tour of campus.

    We will be accepting registrations in late August.

    Available Saturdays:

      Saturday, September 26, 2015
      Saturday, October 24, 2015
      Saturday, October 31, 2015
      Saturday, March 5, 2016
      Saturday, March 12, 2016
      Saturday, April 23, 2016
